questions.uddipok:
Identify the unclear pronoun references in the following paragraph. Where necessary, rewrite the sentences
so that all pronoun references are clear: —

Sunlight is the source of all energy of the earth. All the living beings are dependent upon this. Green plants are
the producer of the ecosystem. All plants and animals of it are interconnected serially. Consequently, there
develops a food chain among these. The transfer of food energy takes place from producers through a series of
food levels. This is called food chain of food in the ecosystem. There are numerous food chains in an
ecosystem. Food chains do not work in isolation. These are linked together to form a food web.

sub_questions.explanation:
Sunlight is the source of all energy of the earth. All the living beings are dependent upon sunlight . Green plants
are the producer of the ecosystem. All plants and animals of the ecosystem are interconnected serially.
Consequently, there develops a food chain among them . The transfer of food energy takes place from producers
through a series of food levels. This process is called food chain of food in the ecosystem. There are numerous
food chains in an ecosystem. Food chains do not work in isolation. They are linked together to form a food web.

[Principal's Name] Principal Dhaka College [Dhaka, Bangladesh]
Subject: Proposal for Establishing an English Language Club
Respected Sir,
I hope this letter finds you in good health and high spirits. I am writing to you, on behalf of the students of Dhaka College, to propose the establishment of an English Language Club within the college premises.
As a second-year college student, I have observed a growing interest among my peers in improving their English language skills. However, we feel that our current academic curriculum may not adequately cater to the practical aspects of language learning, such as speaking and listening proficiency.
The proposed English Language Club would serve as a platform for students to enhance their English language abilities through various interactive activities, such as debates, discussions, public speaking sessions, and language games. Additionally, the club could organize workshops, seminars, and guest lectures by language experts to provide valuable insights and guidance.
Moreover, the English Language Club would foster a sense of camaraderie among students with a shared interest in language learning, promoting cultural exchange and mutual support.
We believe that the establishment of an English Language Club would complement our academic endeavors and contribute to our personal and professional development. Therefore, we earnestly request your support and approval for this initiative.
Thank you for considering our proposal. We look forward to your positive response and guidance on how to proceed further with this endeavor.
Sincerely,
Motin
[Your Signature]

questions.uddipok:
Suppose, you are a reporter of a national daily. Now, write a report on a terrible fire accident in a garments
factory in your locality.

sub_questions.explanation:
A Devastating fire, taking 30 lives



Zabir Khandakar, Dhaka, Mohakhali, 15 October : A devastating fire broke out in Jahan Garment Factory at Mohakhali in the city of Dhaka on 14 October. At least 30 people were killed and over 50 injured. The death toll may rise.


The fire broke out at about 9:00 pm. It is anticipated that the fire might have originated from an electric short circuit at the “Finishing Section” on the second floor of the building.


Smoke engulfed the whole 10 storey building as a result of which people inside the building could not come out of it in spite of their best efforts. The local people and some workers of the factory rushed to the spot but failed to bring the fire under control.


Kamal Hossain, a neighbor of the factory said, “We were in our house. All on a sudden we saw the fire at the 2 nd floor first and then it spread rapidly.”


The Fire Brigade and Civil Defense rushed to the spot immediately to extinguish the fire. The Bangladesh Army, the Bangladesh Air Force also sent their personnel and helicopters to rescue the people.


Rahima, a worker of the garment said, “We saw the fire and wanted to come out but the supervisor locked us.” As the fire spread rapidly, panicked workers were trying to escape. But the only exit was locked, the sources claimed. The wounded were admitted into the nearest hospital and different clinics of the city. The causes of the accident were not ascertained.


A cas was filed in Gulshan Police Station in this connection. The government has formed a five member investigation committee to find out the cause of the fire.

questions.uddipok: Write a composition on “Female Education”. Write at least 200 words but do not exceed 250 words.

sub_questions.explanation: Female education is not just a matter of providing schooling to girls; it is a fundamental right and a powerful tool for social and economic development. When girls are educated, they gain the knowledge, skills, and confidence to pursue their dreams and contribute meaningfully to society. One of the primary benefits of female education is its positive impact on health outcomes. Educated women are more likely to make informed decisions about their health and that of their families, leading to lower maternal and child mortality rates. Additionally, female education plays a crucial role in breaking the cycle of poverty. Educated women have better employment opportunities and higher earning potential, enabling them to support themselves and their families financially. Moreover, educating girls fosters gender equality by challenging traditional gender roles and stereotypes. It empowers women to participate actively in decision-making processes, both at home and in society, and promotes a more inclusive and equitable society overall. Furthermore, female education has far-reaching effects on community development, as educated women are more likely to invest in their children's education and contribute to the socioeconomic development of their communities. Therefore, investing in female education is not only a moral imperative but also a strategic investment in the future prosperity and well-being of nations.

questions.uddipok: Write a short composition on " Impact of Climate Change in Bangladesh ".

sub_questions.explanation:
Impact of Climate Change in Bangladesh
Long-term variation in temperatures and weather patterns is known as climate change. The frequent
shift of climate in Bangladesh has been showing a number of devastating effects, such as, rising sea level, floods and intensifying cyclones, Firstly, Rising sea level is a growing threat to people all around Bangladesh. To illustrate, Two-thirds of the land of this country is less than fifteen feet above sea level. So, the increase of sea level might cause extinction of huge low land area, Respondingly, The dwellers of the area may have to migrate from their own land. Secondly, Climate change is making rainfall more erratic and often far more intense. In terms of Bangladesh, this reality has recently become quite evident, Because of irregular rain and melting the Himalayan glaciers, Bangladesh is now far more vulnerable to devastating floods, Lastly and more importantly, The Bay of Bangal narrows towards its northern shore where it meets the south of coast Bangladesh. This narrowing can both direct cyclones towards Bangladesh's coast and make them more intense. To conclude, to minimize climate change, some immediate steps could be taken such as planting more trees, reducing the use of CFC gases, using electric vehicles, recycling plastic materials, In a word, People should practice eco-friendly behaviors to protect the nature as well as themselves.
